title: Hasagot HaRaavad on Mishneh Torah, Human Dispositions
text: Likewise in connubial etc. Even so in complying with the commandment of a wife's conjugal rights.* Herein are outlines of rules for voluntary conduct. Mandatory laws are given, in this instance, in the book dealing with the subject. See Women, Marriage, 14.7. C.G.

The owner of an evil tongue etc. No, but the first mentioned, namely, the sycophant, is worse than the second, namely, the evil tongue; for the sycophant, mentioned first, is the third to be killed, since sycophancy kills three, whereas the second mentioned is but a sneak killing none but himself.* Maimonides maintains that the evil tongue rather than the sycophant kills three. C.
versions: Mishnah Torah, Yod ha-hazakah, trans. by Simon Glazer, 1927
